Package it.unipr.sowide.actodes.examples.messaging

Shows how actors can exchange messages and how actors can create other actors in remote actor spaces if its execution involves several actors spaces. Both standalone and distributed executions are started by the main method contained in the Initiator class. This class allows to a user to select the type of execution, the number of messages to be sent and the number of nodes of the distributed application. When the execution is distributed on a set of actors spaces, then the first must be a broker actor space, then there can be zero or more node actor space, and finally the last one must be the initiator actor space.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Initiator
    The Initiator class defines a behavior that checks if the application is based on either one or more actor spaces.
    Receiver
    The Receiver class defines a behavior that waits for a specific number of messages from a Sender actor and then kills itself.
    Sender
    The Sender class defines a behavior that sends a specific number of messages to a set of Receiver actors and then waits for their replies.
